Description: An orange glowing object with a red light on the right-hand side.
Very curious. A very bright light, four times that of a star.
A very bright constant red light.
been outside the individuals house for some nights and then onenight.
A UFO.
A diamond shaped red light came towards him from the sea. Rearend of diamond was a blue light. It was incredibly hot as it passedoverhead. No sound.
A silver disc shaped light seen for two minutes. Witness was in hislounge.
A bright object travelling very fast overhead. Not a plane.
Something lit up the sky. There was smoke in the sky afterwards.
Lights in the sky.
A bright orange light.
A UFO.
Two bright lights/objects moving through the sky.
Four bright orange lights in a group.
Over my house. It was massive. Unbelievable. The noise wasincredible. I thought we were under nuclear attack.
Five yellow/orange objects in formation. Moving east to west. Slowbut straight flight.
A UFO. An orange/yellow light.
Four or more moving bright solid orange lights. Followed by a furthereight identical objects. Rose vertically over the side on the valley.Made no sound.

A V shaped formation similar to how birds fly of seven lights. Movedrapidly across the sky rotated slightly then the lights split up andvanished. Lights were size and brightness of stars. No noise and novisible trails in sky.
Five rather big orange things flew over the witness. He was terrified.
Strange lights. Eleven in total.
A green light with a white light on the outer rim. Flew over the hillsand disappeared once it passed the motorway.
An object in the sky over Exeter.
Strange white light, got smaller and turned green. Pulsated inbrightness.
Saw a large shape in the sky. It didn't look like a helicopter butsounded like one and was very loud. It hovered for an hour. Thenheaded towards Caterham.
Object that moved quickly through the sky.
Strange burning objects in the sky.
Object that moved quickly through the sky.
Object that moved quickly through the sky.
A bright yellow light. It vanished for a few seconds then reappeared.
A bright steady light in the sky. It then just moved and disappeared.
A very large ball (looked like a fireball). The object was small, butrather far away

Object had a large light on the front and a smaller red and greenlight on either side, as if on the ends of a planes wings. Base was aperfect square and black in colour. It made a quiet humming sound.
Large ball of light. Light did not diminish. Very strange. Made nosound. Very strange.
Large spherical object, bright orange in colour. Much bigger thanany plane or helicopter. Glowed brightly all over. Was completelysoundless.
Star shaped and very bright, brilliant white. Changing shape. Nonoise.
An extremely bright  blue circular light. After diving down at steepangle, rising then diving again, it vanished.
A strange ball of bright orange light. Light faded out.

A bright oval orange in the sky. Thought at first it was an aircraft onfire. After five minutes the bright glow petered out and then becametotally black. Lived in the area all her life but had never seenanything like it before.

Three orange lights in horizontal line above the opposite side of thehill. Stopped car but saw only four lights, two separate at the top &two close together at the bottom. Top two rose and disappeared.Second two moved higher then also vanished.
Four orange lights. At first mistook them for stars. Faded one by one
Light in the sky. Other lights falling or dripping from it to the ground.At first thought it was fireworks. Made no noise and was the size of ahelicopter.
We keep getting flown over by aliens galore. They are droppinggerms and we keep getting colds. Please send the RAF or USAF tostop them.
15 fireballs in the sky. Not aircraft.
Five orange lights high in the sky over the house. Disappeared intothe atmosphere
Same as the UFO seen over the House of Commons in February2008. Matches description The Sun gave.
Bright clear light shooting across sky. There were blue lights almostin line with the clear light. They were evenly spaced.

A dullish orange light low in the sky. Circular in shape with nodefined edge. Surface had texture of the Sun's surface but not asbright. It reduced in size as it backed away from the witness. Anaircraft flew in its direction whilst giving it a wide berth.
Six red or orange lights in a large oval shape moving slowly towardsBrighton. They made no noise
Series of UFO Sightings. Three orange lights arranged vertically inthe sky. No way they could be aircraft. Four sets of them.
A blue and purple flashing light over the moors for 30 minutes.
A clearly defined, shiny silvery metallic cylinder with rounded ends.Estimated 50ft in length. Small protrusion on upper rear body.Object made no sound nor visible emissions.
White on outer edges. 7-800ft long. Moving very fast from North toSouth.
Strange object seen when he developed photographs he had taken.
Ten orange orbs. Orbs had slightly pulsating orange lights. Not likenavigation lights. Made no noised.
Six lights, some red, some orange and some white all travelling inthe same direction. It was either one big object or six single objects.All travelling in the same direction.
A bright orange light travelling very fast from North to South east.Too large and bright to be a plane. In view for one minute thendisappeared behind a cloud. Noticed no noise or tail.
Strange object in the sky. Bright orange in colour with intensity offire. Like a huge hanglider.
Lights in the sky. Definitely not a plane. Very strange.
Five UFOs. Bright round orange lights. Made no noise. Disappearedin direction on London.
A peculiar bright light. The object was spherical shaped like asatellite. It moved West to East very quickly. Definitely not asatellite, helicopter or light aircraft.
Bright orange lights continuously going up and down on the horizon.Heading East in the direction of Frome or Wiltshire.
An orange/yellow object moving NW to SE. Followed by three more.No navigation lights and they made no sound. Not that high up.Disappeared into the distance quicker than they arrived.

A brightly glowing orange ball. It seemed to be a controlled craft. Ithovered for a couple of minutes then the light seemed todeliberately fade. It was a few hundred feet up and a quarter of amile from the house.
A bright orange object. The top was rounded like the top of a balloonand was a brighter orange towards the bottom. It appeared to bestationary.
Witness saw a long light flashing like a laser. Sometimes there weretwo lights crossing over. This is the third time they have been seenover six weeks.
Two orange lights in the sky that hovered over the old hospital site.The lights were not together but were stationary. They made nonoise. They then moved off in a southerly direction.
Strange lights seen over the bay.
A bright light that went straight up in the sky above the A12 nearColchester.

A dome shaped orange ball of light. It suddenly took off from a field.It was organic like a jellyfish. Transparent, and you could see itsinternal workings. It departed swaying left to right and made adroning noise. 150-200ft in the air.
A ball of light with a few lights inside. It hovered over Gravesend forsome 30 minutes. Too static for a helicopter.

Two strange lights behind the clouds that appeared to be playingwith each other, pretending to crash into each other. Then they werejoined by a third light that hovered underneath them, going back andforth.

Five bright orange lights in the sky. One was in the lead the otherfour in a loose rectangular formation. Disappeared behind trees thenwere seen in a line with long gaps between them. Heard no enginenoise. Headed south for two miles before vanishing.

An object with a white and alternating red lights at an angle. Camefrom South East London towards Canary Wharf. It stopped in mid-airand an alternating sequence of red lights flashed at 180 degrees.Lights switched side instantly.
A single object the size of a large car. Silver with flames flickeringfrom the underside. Then moved up and away.

Object came in trajectory into back garden. It was like the upper partof an egg, glowing bright orange like hot steel. On bottom it hadsomething like a root structure. It looked like it was having sometrouble but righted itself, and gently flew off.
80 bright lights over the top of Queen's Hill in Swindon.
A sizeable, silent, flickering orange light. Difficult to judge height andspeed but much slower than any meteorite and much faster than theprevailing wind which was negligible.
A ball of light in the clouds, moving slowly and falling apart. Hadother white lights coming off it. Made no sound.
It was the flashing of a huge object with one normal and two greenlights. It was flying low. Only saw it for four seconds than it vanishedfrom sight.
Saw four spaceships that flew over the house into the sky. They hada bright light that faded and was then gone. They returned to thesame spot they had come from.
A very bright object that glows red and bright.

Two lights above the cloud with beams of light coming out fromthem horizontally. Dotting about like two fireflies. The beams arecoming from the lights, not the ground. Seen to the north. The lightsare very round and flying in a small area.

One white light to the south east that flashes red, green and an offyellow at about 8-10000ft. Another across central London at 10-15000ft with the same colours. Objects are identical and 3-4 milesapart on the approach path to Heathrow or London City.
Two orange lights over Hayle Estuary moving at the speed of ahelicopter but had no aircraft navigation lights.
Bright orange object travelling west to east across the sky.
A big yellow glow in the sky to the south of Aberdeen. About 2500fthigh but not aircraft landing lights.
Orange lights in the sky. Like fairy lights. Made no sound
Lights like little stars in a half moon shape. A bright light at thecentre was moving very slightly.

Three very bright orange lights in triangular formation. They werecircular with no tails. Travelling at speed towards the east. Made nosound. Could not tell height. Visible for 4-5 minutes before fadingaway one by one.

A swarm of about 100 flashing white lights, high in the sky movingfrom the NE to SE. Very quick and keeping equidistant and of equalspeed. Disappeared about 45 degrees above the horizon. Theswarm moved in an arc of 40 degrees in about 10 seconds.
Various different lights in a star shape.
Two sphere like objects orange/red in colour. The first object ranparallel to the witness, dropped then disappeared. The secondobject moved straight across the sky line then disappeared.
An object in the sky changing colour.

A large fireball but with an oblong shape. Thought it was a crashingairliner but it stopped and hovered. It then came towards Dascar,stopped and headed in a SE direction towards Bury. It hovered inthe distance for a minute before disappearing.
An object hovering in the sky. The object had bright lights.

An emerald green object that was like a torchlight or a largegrapefruit. It flitted up, down and around outside the landing window.The beam of light narrowed and it came back as a ball shape. It wasstill for 90 seconds then vanished.
A long cylinder of gold light. It looked like a very bright shooting star.Observed it for 3 seconds.
The whole object was glowing like hot metal and there was nosound. It was travelling at the speed of a fighter or a satellite, fromNW to SE. It looked to be flying quite low.
Strange orange lights in the sky.
A big bright red ball of fire travelling at a terrific speed.
Two UFOs. Orange globes that moved near together then separatedand very gradually disappeared.
Five strange orange lights in formation, moving very quickly.

Object was travelling east/southeast. An extremely bright, constantred/orange light shining down. The shape of the object was obscuredby the light. It made no sound. Cannot determine speed, but wasvisible for two minutes. May have speeded up.
A bright orange light, the size of a helicopter. It looked like a flameor a flare but made no sound. It was moving very slowly.
The shape of a rectangle. It had a dull green glow with no otherlights showing.
A wide pear drop shaped translucent green light with a small tail oflight. Moved in NW direction. Made no noise and vanished after afew seconds.
Three orange lights, evenly spaced and moving at the same speed.Gradually disappeared after five minutes. Heading from SE to NW.
A red fire ball travelling at extreme speed. It made no sound.Heading from Coventry to Leominster.
Two very bright glowing orange lights moving at very high speed.
A constant light travelling West to East. Very erratic, wobbling offcourse then just disappeared.
Large bright light seen to the east of Exton, moving south to north athigh speed- at first mistaken for a planet.
A bright diamond shaped light. Definitely not an aircraft. Faster thanan aircraft. Headed east for one minute before moving upwards anddisappearing.
Looked like a satellite crashing or a star. It was fairly pacey and thenslowed to a halt. It moved off after 20 seconds and gathered speed.It became a dot and vanished.
Four UFOs flying beneath two aircraft. They moved much fasterthan the aircraft. Greyish in colour with a dome on top and bottom.Flew over the Waterton Industrial Estate.

A very bright spherical object. Size of a full moon. Yellow/orange incolour. Object seemed wrapped in a bright glowing cloud of light. Itmade no noise. It moved towards Hascombe. Performed a series oferratic moves.

Three objects in the sky. They were circling and dipping in and outof the clouds. They could have been light sources or just reflectinglight. A possible tail of light at a slight angle away from the directionof travel on each of the objects.
A group of very bright orange objects heading NW to SE at aconsistent speed and low altitude. There was a group of 15 followedby groups of 2-3 and 3-4 over a five minute period. They made nonoise.
Three bright lights heading in the same direction some 2 minutesapart. The 3rd light disintegrated and spilt up.
A massive orange thing. Going so fast it passed a plane goingtowards RAF Lyneham.
A bright orange ball of fire. It was quite high up in the sky over thehouse. It was changing colour and disappeared straight into the sky.
It was square with orange lights.
Two UFOs.
Object seen for 6-7 minutes.
Something peculiar.
Very bright white light. Its trail followed it for half an hour headingtowards Brough.
A ball of fire.

Looked like a squashed balloon and had no wings. Rounder at thefront and pointed at the back. It had no lights at the front but 2-3 atthe back, one red, one red and flashing and one white/green.Witness heard the noise first which grew louder.
Two parallel lights. Red or orange lights in the sky.
A very bright orange glow. Moved about the speed of an airliner,heading south to north.
A UFO.
A big ball of fire, like a star. It decreased in size over two minutes.
Several orange lights, same colour and brightness of street lights.Three were close together and the others were in a horizontal line.
A Light. Moved past very slowly then shot off at phenomenal speed.It was round but twice it changed into a cone shape. 300-400ft up.
Four glowing objects coming from southwest and then turned north.They were glowing duller and brighter, then disappeared.
A UFO.
A ball of glowing red light. After 30 seconds the light dimmed slightlyand then just disappeared.
Looked like a Chinese lantern.

Two orangey lights in the sky moving towards each other. Then aball of light approached the other lights. All three were stationary fora while before disappearing into the distance. Another light thenhovered where the others had been.
A bright orange light approached at low level and then remainedstationary for 10 minutes. Then it turned red.
A round yellow ball. It looked like it had a parachute on top, theshape of a helmet.
Nine green lights in the sky.
Two objects, five minutes apart heading East to West. They lookedlike orange fiery balls but made no sound. They travelled at thespeed of a plane. They had no tail.
Two yellow objects like giant sparklers heading North to South.
A UFO.
A orange ball in the sky, travelling very quickly then stopped andfaded away.
An oval shaped glowing red object, in two dimensions. It spun in onedirection then reversed and swung in the other.
A UFO Southwest of Liverpool.
Lights rising from the ground into the sky, much like debris from afire. However lights were too intense to be a fire. Seen in thedirection of the North Downs from Maidstone.
A bright orange object moving at a steady pace.
A bright flaming object, about a quarter of the size of the moon. Itwas like a special effect. It was silent and went from horizon tohorizon, starting in the North.
Like a large black parachute with nothing suspended from it. Itchanged shape and gradually got smaller as it went into thedistance. Observed for 10-20 minutes.

A long shaped vehicle with a red light at the front and two gold lightseither side. Hovered above the house and then moved off to theright at tremendous speed before returning. It then drifted slowlyaway. It was louder than a plane or helicopter.
A bright red light over the house.
A large black ball with a light underneath. Travelling South overwestern Bury St Edmunds at 3000ft at 200 miles an hour.
A black spherical object 12m in diameter. It was 500ft up andtravelling at 500 mph. It made no sound. It had a light on butswitched it off when the witness shone a torch at it.
Two bright lights heading towards the city. Like a white octopusshaped kite. It was like they were propelled but travelling on theirown.
A spherical object with a red flashing light underneath. It wasstationary in the sky for 10 minutes and then just faded away. It hadmade no movement at all.

Single small white orb shortly joined by two others. Changed into adull flat circular shape. They were hovering over Central London at15-20,000 ft but not blown by the wind. Objects disappeared but onereappeared for five minutes.
Looked like a star or satellite. Saw three within 20 minutes. Camefrom the south. Its speed increased and then slowed down. Finallyheaded east over the North Sea.
A big bright orange light. It turned white and then disappeared veryquickly. It made no noise.
A sighting.

Two orange lights flying in a parallel formation in an arc. One slowedand went behind the other then they both gradually faded away. Fartoo fast to be aircraft. They had no flashing lights and made nosound.
A very small white light with no flashing lights or smoke trail.Headed north then did a sharp turn to the east and then was justgone.
A bright green light that whizzed about the sky for an hour. It wasvery fast and a few planes got in its way.
Saw orange lights that looked like flames. They were heading Southto North towards Preston. Police said it was the open rear of anaircraft undertaking parachute training.
Six very bright orange lights flying in formation passed by in 15minutes. Heading from Upper Norwood towards Crystal Palace.
Initially one then five pitch black hot air balloon shaped objects withcontinual flames underneath.
A large bright yellow object hovering in the sky. Too bright to be anaircraft and the wrong colour. It didn't move for ages and thendisappeared in the blink of an eye.
A slow moving, silent, orangey/red light. Does not think it was ahelicopter or aircraft. Flew at same height as a helicopter.
Six bright white & orange lights, two single and two in two objectformation. Lower and faster than a satellite. Witness contacted localpolice who had no other reports.
Two bright orangey/red lights  moving towards Durham/Tees ValleyAirport. The objects flew steady, level and straight.
A shiny black flying cylinder, 20-30ft long at about 4700ft which was200ft above the pilots aircraft. Although the pilot sighted the object.Air Traffic Control forwarded details to the UFO Desk.
Seven orange orbs that suddenly disappeared. They were on aNorth-South trajectory. Witness contacted Cardiff Air Traffic Controlwho had nothing on radar.
Nine bright orange lights moving at slow speed and at 2000ft. Theymade no sound.
An orange flash and a loud bang.

Three bright small lights very close together travelling in a straightline. They were flashing rapidly but made no noise and looked likethey were on fire but clearly were not. Speed of 100-150mph at1000ft. Came back eight minutes later.
A UFO over the witnesses house. It was at 30,000ft and he has seenit before.

A diamond shaped orange light. If you held out your hand it wouldhave been the size of a 20p coin. It was totally silent. The objectcarried on in the distance and then another one appeared andfollowed the same path.
Four big lights in a line formation. Two dropped down and the othertwo moved off quickly into the distance.
Twenty orange balls heading north.
Like a star, but jumping all over the sky. It was 70 degrees abovethe horizon. It was a blue/white colour and occasionally red and lefta light trail.
A very bright light. It made no sound but was very low.

A bright orange light. Too bright for a Chinese lantern. The lightlooked electrical not a flame. Travelled in a straight line at a steadyspeed. Travelled East to West with the wind. Made no noise. It wasabout the size of a quarter moon.
Four flaming balloons that disappeared over the horizon fairlyquickly. Was not very high.
A strange blue light near the Cardington Hangers. Flew straight pastthe witness.
8-10 bright red lights. They were hovering. They movedindependently into the distance and disappeared when a light aircraftappeared.
Seven bright orange lights in the sky. Silent. Travelling towards theWirral.
A big bright light. Came from west Cornwall towards Plymouth.
A series of orange balls of fire.

An ellipse shaped object the size of a commercial plane. It was onfire. It glowed bright orange. It moved South East to North and thenreturned and hovered for at least a minute. Moved further away atsupersonic speed.
A very bright blue light flew behind the house.
Very strange circular objects without definite shape. They stayedaround for about five minutes. They were 8-9 of them.
Ten orange lights in a line with intermittent gaps. They made nosound and flew at helicopter height.
A big bright light. Thought it was a helicopter at first. Within secondsfollowed by three others and then a further three. Flew low but madeno sound.
A strange sighting.
A very big red light moving slowly. It then faded away.
An orange light travelling from the south. It was followed by twomore orange lights on the same path, then five more and then twomore. They made no noise but were at the height of a helicopter.
Seven bright red lights.

A white object with a silver beam coming from it, over PugneysCountry Park. It looked square but changed shape as it movedabout. Witness saw it through binoculars. An aircraft flew very closeto it.

Three objects like fireballs falling to earth. They were glowing andorange. There was one large object and two smaller ones whichconverged together and rose into the atmosphere until they fadedaway.
Three small yellow orbs travelling quite slow.
A UFO. It was a "glowing ball of something or other". Definitely not aplane.
A sighting.

A bright circular amber light, the size of a 2p coin. It was movingvery slowly in a straight line but once it flew over the witnesseshouse it accelerated away very very quickly into the distance. Itmade no noise and left no vapour trail.

Two clusters of bright lights. They were stationary for a while thenthe first group of 15 headed towards Woodbridge followed by thesecond cluster of 6-7 lights. They were very high up. They made nosound.
Three distinct sets of green, orange and white lights. Don't matchany constellation and are in the wrong place. Static to the eye butwith binoculars are moving at speed and at random.
Was watching shooting stars when the witness saw two brightluminous orange objects like birds or swans. Does not think theywere birds as they moved too fast.
Black shaped square object.
Two objects seen.  Photograph taken in June a week after themystery hot air balloon search.
Saw a long greyish tube in the sky, when driving home along theA4031.
A sighting.
Eleven bright star like objects heading North East.
Bright orange lights. A single light followed by a group of three andthen another single light. On a North East to South West track.
Different coloured pulsating lights. Police checked with Air TrafficControl who said they had nothing. Police suspect Chinese lanterns.
Initially two UFOs increasing to six. Bright orange. Last four werebigger and brighter than the first two.
A very bright orange circular shape. Got smaller as it moved away.Moving South West to South.
A UFO.
Black disc shaped objects hovering over crop circles near BarburyCastle. They cast shadows on the ground.

Two huge lights chasing each other like cat and mouse. It wasbroken cloud and the lights would never leave the clouds, just go tothe edge. It looked like a strong light was coming from above theclouds. They both shot off to the North.
A large orange glowing ball in the sky. It was stationary and not veryhigh up.
A UFO.
Two objects the size of light aircraft but perfectly spherical andglowing bright orange. They were solid and made no sound. Theyheaded NW to SE.
11-12 objects in the sky. Witness thinks they may be Chineselanterns.
Ten orange lights moving at a sedate pace West to East. Went fromhorizon to horizon in two minutes.
50-100 objects moving together in the same direction. They werehelicopter sized but made no noise.
A light at about 1000ft. It split in two and flew away.
A circular object, metallic in colour. It was following a plane. It shotdownwards several times and then back up again to the same levelas the plane.
A bright circle of fire travelling South Westerly. It was only a fewhundred feet up moving silently across the sky at 30mph and thenafter four minutes, vanished.
Looked like a highly lit aeroplane with wings. It was heading NNW toSSE. It was visible for 20 seconds then changed direction quicklyand dropped out of the sky or disappeared.

Witness was watching two helicopters (one a Chinook) coming fromthe Edinburgh area when she saw an orb shaped object through herbinoculars glistening in the sun. The orb was quite high above thehelicopters.
Three orange lights south of Bridport coming from the east. Theywere the size of a two thirds moon. Moved away to the West rapidlydiminishing.
Twelve bright lights in the sky. Moving slowly.

Object approached from the direction of Doncaster. It was a brightorange ball in the sky. It kept a level flight path then stopped. It thenzigzagged a few times before shooting off  at tremendous speed,vanishing in a few seconds.
Six round brilliant objects in pairs, apart from the last two which werein line. Travelling South to East.
A UFO.
An orange light. Light(s) travelled in formation like a mis-shapeddiamond. There were 12-13 of them. They travelled left to right.
Red objects moving slowly. They were not high and were silent.Might have been going over Bakewell.
Nine objects like golden globes. They hovered for a bit and werejoined by three others before shooting off.
Two orange balls of light travelling North in parallel to each other.Then a further ball of light was seen, heading North. The lights madeno noise. They faded and then disappeared.
Two brown objects like balls of fire. Appeared to be in convoyheading towards Portreath.
Four UFOs flying North. They were silent. A plane was flying in theopposite direction.

Up to 20 orange and red glowing lights. They appeared to be information and under some form of control. They came from theEastern horizon. They moved upwards, were then stationary, movedside to side and then disappeared upwards. Seen for 20 minutes.
A roundish glowing shape. Flying at a steady speed with no noise. Itwas a clear night. Filmed it but the camera died.
Something strange.

Seemed like a rather large disc or round in appearance. It was darkin colour but bounced sunlight off its surface. It was floating orbobbing up and down. Other aircraft were at the same altitude andcould be heard, the object made no noise.
Two UFOs.

Several sightings over the period. A bright orb that travelled in astraight line. As a helicopter approached it the orb slowed down andvanished. Helicopter reacted as if pilot was startled. Saw severalother orbs, but the main one was half the size.

A bright orange light seen through the tree line. It turned and clearedthe tree line. The other side of the object appeared to be a largerectangle shape of fire red/orange. It was silent. The object slowlyclimbed in the direction of Gloucester.

Two very bright orange lights that appeared to get closer to the carthen just hung in the sky. Five minutes later a second bright orangelight with red glow seen then disappeared. A third light then hung inthe sky and disappeared after five minutes.
Six bright orange/red lights in formation. They climbed like balloonsand made no sound. A sphere like a balloon appeared at the sideand then another.
A round orange light.
A bright yellowy orange object, travelling SE to NW in a straight line.It made no noise. At a 50 degree angle of elevation.
Eight alien aircraft seen just above helicopter height travelling SWto NE. There was a humming sound. They looked like they were"eyeing the place up".
12-15 objects. Not like normal fixed wing aircraft, more like brightorange lights. Moving West at indeterminate height. Objects enteredcloud then turned around.
A red light followed by 7 others. They came from the West, flewoverhead and disappeared. Definitely not aircraft.
Some 30 orange lights heading from Birmingham Airport towardsColeshill.

Three very bright orange lights. Fairly large and moving much fasterthan an aircrfat. They disappeared. Then two lights appeared fromthe South. The lights appeared co-ordinated. They were not aircraft.

A dormant blue light which changed colour many times over thehour it was witnessed. At first it was moving steadily and then itstopped in  mid air. Then started moving from left to right. A whitebeam could be seen shining down from it. It had red lights.
Two objects, one with a brighter light. The second one was behind itand had a dimmer light. No navigation lights. Not normal. Reluctantto say it was a UFO - perhaps it is a plane.
A UFO. Witness photographed it.
Five orange bright lights. Half a mile distance between each one.Took photos.
Fast, shiny discs. Lower and faster than a plane, not a plane orhelicopter. Sphere, brilliant light.
Two sightings. First at 12:30 (bright light), second at 01:30 (flashinggreen).
Observed fifty golden balls moving slowly SSE.

Having a BBQ with some friends when saw an orange fireball aboutto crash two gardens away, but on checking it was now high in thesky about half mile away. 3-5 minutes later another object appearedthen a third spherical object with a leg protruding.
A UFO.
Ball of light. No noise. Bright light, rising behind a fence, went upinto the sky.
Huge red light, moving through sky.
A UFO.
No description provided.

A large bright silver/white ball/sphere. Moving slowly W to E. theobject was much bigger and brighter than an aircraft. It appeared tostop still several times as it went into the distance. The light did notdim as it moved further away.
Very bright, very big, not a satellite, not a plane, stationary. Lightdisappeared.
Bright star, went from bright yellow to bright red. Did not look like ashooting star or plane. Moved no more than 2-3 feet.
A UFO.

A round white object. Not like a ball. Very bright but not casting abeam of light. It was rising vertically. The higher it went the smaller itbecame. It started the size of a pound coin and ended as a pin head.Witness observed the object for two minutes.

A very bright white light like a star. It moved south then doublebacked on itself and was joined by another light. The lights dancedround each other then split and moved off in different directions. Thelight suddenly disappeared.
A UFO.
A ball of light the size of a small car, 26 metres above the ground. Itpulsated every 5-8 seconds but then shot off. Definitely not anaircraft or a Chinese Lantern.
A bright orange light, which hovered in one place. It became morepink, than red and then it disappeared.
A metallic aircraft shaped like a missile. One quarter was white,another green/blue and another red. Was circling. It had no wingsand was moving diagonally. It made a sound like a motorbike.
Saw an object like a ball of fire.
Has a video of UFO on his mobile phone.
An orb like object at 120 degrees from North. Orange in colourmoving in a NE direction. Visible for 10 minutes. It had no aircrafttype navigation lights.
Three bright orange lights, not flashing. Very big, high up, setequally apart. Reported it to RAF Northolt. Never saw anything likethis before.
A UFO of orangey/red colour. It hovered and moved slightly in thedirection of Stroud, then suddenly dropped downwards.
10-15 circular objects.
A bright, reddish light travelling W to E, below cloud level. It madeno sound. It was moving in a straight line but too slow to be ameteorite. It had no navigation type lights.
10-12 bright orange objects, silent. Has a photo of them saved onhis mobile.
A UFO.
Six yellow lights, stationary at first then moved off.
Four-five orange lights, fluctuating lights. Lives under flight path ofDonnington airfield. Objects moved in a line. Lights faded. Returned10 minutes later.
Video footage in Cornwall near an Air Station (possibly Culdrose).Five minute sighting.
Large round object. Two planes flew round it. Could be somethingnatural, such as an eclipse.
Light seen in sky also above this was a large round shape whichlooked rocky and was blue and pink in colour.
15 to 20 orange and red lights looked as though they were comingdown to land but then went over head and 'went out'.

Saw through the clouds flashing pale blue lights odd shapes butmostly circles. Movement continued for 25 minutes. A small red lightwas on outside parameter of blue lights whichdisappeared/amalgamated into one large blue light which speedilydisappeared.
Bright, oval shaped object with red and green lights. No noise.
Large balloon shape, with 'shimmer fire' effect underneath it.
UFO seen with another one circling it.  There was one main light andno sound.
Big and very bright red/yellow/orange ball seen flying past backendof garden, just under cloud cover. Then went through cloud coverand lit cloud cover up.

Orange light, with 'some sort of flame' in the sky.  Moved fromdriveway to over the front of the house.  Then changed directiontowards Wallgrave, direction changed again towards Reading thenback in the direction of Wallgrave.
Fifteen red/orangey lights in sky, which gradually started fading outand then disappearing.
Six orange, with fire around, UFOs in formation (One behind theother across horizon to horizon).

Six orange/white lights, lying astern.  Thought they were aircraftnavigation lights but were evenly spaced out.  No noise but movedwith speed of a passing helicopter. Changed into a 'hammer head'shape.
Six or seven bright lights which were in the sky for approximately 10minutes. They were spaced out and one by flew away anddisappeared very quickly.
Three orange lights high in the sky over the sea.  There was anexplosion and the centre light then dropped into the sea.  No soundheard from the lights.

Seven bright orange lights in a straight line. Only two lights were inview at any time. As the last two came a white moon ball flew overat double the speed of the orange lights. Thirty minutes later sixwhite balls in a triangle formation were seen.
Triangular shaped object.
Three huge orange lights. First and second objects moving at speedof an aircraft. Third object moving much faster as if trying to catchup.
Two bright orange lights, three to four minutes a part and no soundheard.  Lights then went into clouds.

Five, really bright orange flame ball type objects seen flying acrossthe sky, moving irregularly. One moving faster than a plane and onezig-zagged down towards the ground then reappeared after the otherfour had moved across the sky and had gone.
First saw three orange objects. Forty minutes later, looking Northsaw an orange glowing object travelling slowly from SW to NE. Itwas at an angle to the ground of about 30-40 deg.
A bright orange light travelling in a straight line from BrightonCentre. Which then passed over the house.
Saw an orange, yellow object in the sky, with the shape similar to ahot air balloon.
Has a UFO report in their office.
Three bright orange lights and one dimmer one. Faded after beingstatic.
Saw a UFO.
Went to get cat off wall, saw UFO higher than eye level, brightorange object, not plane shaped, no engine noise.
Just reported a sighting.  No other details.
Bright object in sky, very large.
60-70 lights, suddenly disappearing.
Nine bright orange circular shapes glide across sky. Sighting lasteda couple of minutes.
Clusters of UFOs, orange lights in distance. Zoomed off when theygot closer, big and round.
Large orange ball of flame.  Lasted 20 seconds.
Lights moving slowly. One light lead a group of five, with one lightacting as tail ender.
17 UFO's above village. Red and green lights, no sound.
Orange lights in sky.
Looked like aeroplane on fire.
Scary sighting.
Orange point of light in the sky.  No haze or smoke visible aroundthe object. Object was flickering slightly. Lasted about 60 secs.
Bright light.
Saw glider like objects in the sky. Flying around in an anti-clockwisedirection.
Red object, looked like a clod, went over the roof and vanished. Nonoise/engine. Big orange colour lower than a plane. Gliding straight.
Large orange glow in sky, moving slowly than disappeared.Reappeared after five minutes. Knows a bit about astronomy.
Low bright light.
Saw orange ball in distance, no flashing lights, no engine noise. Leftsuddenly.
Large oval craft seen, very low and could not make out anydistinguishing features. It had on it a number of red, orange andgreen lights.  Sighting lasted only 5-10 seconds.

A bright white fire ball, size of a football flew into the kitchen andlanded in a plastic carrier bag on the table, immediately disappearedbut seemed to cause almost blinding white, sheet lightening.

Saw an orange light rising from the SE - looked like the tail from arocket launch like when the shuttle goes up. Object then movednorth before disappearing behind clouds. Happened three times overa period of 30 minutes. Third time bright flash.
Large bright light. Looked like a ball of fire or a hot air balloon.

Saw four strange orange lights in the sky following each other.Lights then just disappeared. Lights then seen again moving acrossthe night sky.  Went inside and saw the same lights in a three prongtriangle.
Saw six moving orange balls, glowing. They were following eachother.  One minute between them.  There was no noise.
Orb shape, glowing on underside only. Orange colour. Orange fadedand object looked like a black shadow.
Big circular orange lights.
Unusual lights above Cardiff travelling silently.
Six balloons of fire over Ullswater.  These UFOs moved at differentspeeds to each other and in different directions before burning out.
Unusual lights travelling silently from West to East.
Six to seven bright orange lights, moving down Wirral peninsulafrom Birkenhead to Ellesmere Port. No noise. Saw a second UFOfive minutes later.
Eight orange, non-flashing lights, made no sound. Round shapes.
Four wavering lights, hovering, taken on a video camera andphotographed.
Five to six objects.
Two yellow lights one above the other in the sky.  On arriving homefive minutes later watched the lights disappear behind a narrowcloud bank.
Two sightings observed. One in summer 2008 single brightyellow/white light moving fast. Second sighting in daylight singlebright yellow/white 2009 moving fast.
Bright orange bulb. Stayed for 10 minutes, came towards him like atornado then disappeared.
Very large bright light, no sound.

Bright orange object which looked as though it was on fire. Movingat a steady pace, slowed then gained altitude slowly anddisappeared into the clouds.  Sighting lasted 2-3 minutes.  Objectwas similar to a hot air balloon but had no outline or shape.
Bright light form the northwest - lights went out, turned towards thesouth.
Saw a very bright orange ball shaped object in the sky. No noisefrom object. Went to get mobiles to take pictures and videos butobject had just vanished.
Lights coming towards me. 40-50 lights.
One object seen in the sky in the day time.
Report received from "Psychic Control Centre", ref: PO255401.
Report on behalf of her sister, who said she saw a UFO at HolbornStation.
Bright red orange ball, no sound, moved faster than an aircraft.Could not find a camera in time to take photos.

UFO visible for 6 -7 second. Changed direction by approx 60 degsdownward towards the horizon before disappearing. Object was adull brown colour, with a magnitude of 3.5 to 5 and resembled aslightly luminous brown paper bag. No sound was heard.
Saw a meteor shower which contained something he could notexplain.
Bright light shone through the window. Saw three lights size of abasket ball moving up/down and rotating on own axis. Seemed toloose power after 30 seconds and vanished.
Dog wanted to go out, went out and I saw a UFO.
No flashing lights, orange looking object. Looked like it washovering, flew towards observer's car and faded slowly into thedistance.
Pair of "lanterns" directly overhead, slightly faster than a plane,faster than a satellite, slower than a meteor.
One light, joined by another, hovering over the village. No noise.One light no longer there, the other disappeared. Like a lightbulbwith an orange top
Very bright light, stops and spins slowly, moves right and left, as iflooking for something or taking photos, long beams of light. Nosound.
Bright orange light, definitely not a plane.
Two bright orange lights. Witnessed for about five minutes.

Emitting a large bright orange light much larger than normal lightson a plane/helicopter, travelling in an arc with no sound. After 10mins light became dimmer and appeared to gain height, light nowsize as normal aircraft light and disappeared.
A bright orange object. Above cloud level. Travelling at a high rateof knots. Came inland from the coast over Exmouth and headed offtowards Woodbury and Taunton.
Was carrying a camera, as is her usual practice, saw a pinpoint, asilver dot that was clearly a UFO.
Three red lights in the shape of a triangle with the nose movingforward, not a usual aircraft, suspect it was a UFO.
Three orange orbs and two red orbs.
Wish to report a UFO.

Circular shape in with a mixture of stars, one was getting brighterand then dimmer and disappearing for a short number of minutes.Another red light hovered around the object. Camera on phonewould not pick anything up.
Lights in sky.
Saw a UFO - can you call me back.
Saw something strange. Can you phone me back.
Five orange globe balls.
UFO at the back of the sky
Tall and thin, like a pencil, square, blue black.
Saw 40 flickering orange lights from kitchen window. They made nonoise and moved round to the side window of the house anddisappeared behind a cloud.  Watched them for 5-10 minutes.
Two orbs, flickering lights, sliding across the sky.

Around eight yellow balls of light floating slowly in the night sky,slowly disappearing. Then one or two more would appear 500 to 800ft and follow same line of flight.  This happened for around twominutes.
Large orange light with no noise.
Saw a UFO.
Bright orange lights, lasted for two minutes, went out, than fourmore. Could have been a meteorological balloon. A very bright light.
Three lights in formation, forming an isosceles triangle. Two lightsvisible at first, then joined by a third. Light lasted for 2-3 minutes. Nosound.
Report of a UFO.
A large orange fireball burning for 35 seconds. No noise from objectwhich reduced in size until nothing over the duration of its flight.
Strange lights over G62 0TD. Two big white lights.
Seven aircraft over Derby.
It got brighter and dimmer
Came over top of field - red- flew very quickly like a shooting star.
Round shape - lightening then darkening with a dark shape behind it.No engine noise.
Saw a bright light heading towards Essex - bright light standing still.
Orange ball going in a straight line.  No visible trail.  No smoke ornoise. Appeared to be getting smaller burning itself up.
Saw what looked like a flying log, blue with a white edge.
Terrestrials seen coming from King's Lynn towards Swaffham,Norfolk.
Saw a sighting in Gloucester.
Two UFOs flying overhead.
Has video of UFO with no sound.
Two glowing sphere/domed -shaped objects followed each in SouthEast direction.  Completely silent and not flashing at all, as youwould expect from aircraft.
One object rising in the sky. Semi circle outline. Flames glowingorange/red.  Flickering round the edge. At first thought it was afirework, then it disappeared.
Seven lights over Yeovil.  No noise.
Orange lights following each other in same direction. No noise, noflashing lights, same trajectory. In vicinity of Lyneham radar.  Somelights disappeared.
Saw lights, moved into view from right to left, then stop and form apattern before pulsing and fading out their bright orange lights.
Twenty-two lights.  No noise, same speed.
Saw strange lights in the sky, in three's then one, then two's, thenthree's - Fifteen in all.

Red fire like ball . Glow was constant.  It was travelling at a constantspeed West to East. Also watched it through binoculars and itappeared as a red circle with dots around the circle. In 10 o'clockposition and watched it for 4-5 mins.

Saw eight orange single lights in the sky. Lights were very clear,single bright orange spot, which travelled at constant speed slowlyhigher into the eastern atmosphere. At first four lights in closeproximity followed by four more with approx one minute.

Approx 10 orange lights flying over. First eight were going at asteady, slow rate, three of which merged into a triangle formation,separated then disappeared. Two others appeared about a minute orso travelling faster and disappeared at same area of sky.
Saw a vertical cylinder, silvery colour and underneath was a greatbright yellow, fiery glow.  Watched the object for about 20 minutes.
Ball of fire in the sky.
Very bright object above the sun.
Six bright orange lights - not flashing - silent. After a few minutesthere was another one.
Saw a very bright light - looking south to right of the moon.  It wasvery large.  There were four or five bright lights.
Moving very fast SE to North and watched object for about 10seconds. Thought at first it was a star or a plane.

Brilliant and dazzling pure white horizontal ring of light.  It appearedto be perfectly still in the sky above the houses and was totallysilent.  Object was hovering over the Belle Vue Crescent area.
Low flying object.  Nine orange lights, no sound.

Eight, orange UFOs, shone brightly, travelling at speed, low in thesky. Objects came across one by one with approx 20 secondsbetween them. They stopped over the reservoir changed direction atapprox 90 deg angle towards Holmfirth.  No noise.
Semi-circle of light, golden orange, moved off towards the east.  Nonoise heard.
Saw 25 to 30 bright orange lights in the sky - Flying in a triangularshape.
Fifteen to twenty bright vertical line going slowly - no noise.
Saw three UFOs which appeared to be composed of fiery orangelight and a symmetrical vertical diamond shape.  No sound.
Pink and red dome with a bright yellow light underneath. For about30 seconds.
Two round balls were in the sky chasing each other.
Thirty orange globes, in four waves, travelling at a constant speed.May have been lanterns of some kind but they would have been 1-2Metres in diameter.
Saw Orange flamed lights, in formation slowly and silently acrossthe night sky.

Black sphere. Bobbing about half a mile away . Covered with aphospherous chemical cloud.  It goes light grey. Flash of lighteningthen re-appears. Some of the clouds light up.  Various sightings20:30 and 12:15.
Saw a UFO it was not a plane it disappeared very quickly.
An intense, bright white light seen between the flight path of Gatwickand Heathrow.
Just a sighting.
White fixed wing object. Flying over a field, East Street, CharlesBarn.  It was squared off with something behind it - no cockpit- silentnot a glider.

Saw over the roof of their house orange/gold round circle about thesize of a beach ball moving from behind the house going sidewaysacross the roof  and down the road. As it moved down the road itchange to a smaller light with no fiery glow.
Twelve circles.

Three blazing gold orbs in a diagonal line in the sky. No sound.Remained static approx one minute before moving slowly togetherto form a shape like Orion's Belt and then into a small triangle. Twolights further out faded and disappeared then third too.
Seven silent objects emitting a bright orange light. One group ofthree and then singles. Travelled at about 100 knots then turnedright.
Seven objects. One group of three, followed by one group of four.Orange, large no distinct shape. Bright, no noise.
Saw bright orange red light in the sky.  The light took severalminutes before it began to dim. Its path was straight and steady,indicating perhaps powered flight.
Strange red and orange object in the sky.
Saw an extremely bright star like light in sky. Continued flying thenstarted to climb vertically no change in speed the dimmed anddisappeared to a faint light.
A bright orange light moving across the sky no noise.
Saw an object in sky like a fireball. It burnt pretty brightly, then wouldburn out a little then appear to burn brightly again beforeextinguishing about thirty seconds later.
Six to eight red lights moving across the skyline. Red spheres with awhite centre. Eventually passed over the house from back to thefront.

Saw an orange light in the distance.  It came nearer and eventuallydisappeared into cloud overhead but before it did saw other similarlights appearing in the distance. They were travelling at regularintervals.
Saw three consecutive passes of single, bright yellowish lights.Moving approximately three minutes apart on the same orbit.
Three objects, like bright orange tennis balls stuck together flyingacross the sky.

Object was similar to an egg shape and was amber in colour andappeared to be hovering over  field's before disappearing.  Fiveminutes later two objects appeared in same area, then disappearedand reappeared over the Meni Straits.
Orange light in sky.
Series of 30 or more orange lights which then disappeared aftermoving at speed.

Saw four lights travelling together. One veered off heading East.Three remained in a triangle formation. Two disappeared into thehorizon and one light went overhead. Looked like a red fireball nosound.

Saw eight to ten lights in the sky. First appeared like very brightfireworks which are fired vertically into the sky. In no particularpattern stayed at same flight level, no engine sound. Picked upspeed and disappeared. Lasted about five minutes.
Forty to fifty orange lights following the same trajectory with morelights coming over.

Two orbs in the sky.  Lead aircraft stopped dead in mid air thenbacktracked for a second or two before rising directly vertical approx200-500m then stopping. As lead craft came within 50m of othercraft both headed off into the distance.

Two orange lights travelling over Harpley village and did not flickeror flash. Distance between the lights was approx 10m and 60ftabove ground and there was no sound. Turned car around but it haddisappeared.
A red/orange light passed over head. Looked like a gaseous, golfballwith a red rotating light, rotating clockwise inside it.
Six strange lights flew low no sound of engines with orange, red andother colours.
Saw five orange lights in the sky in a line.
A very unusual object flew across the sky.  The object was a coneshape with a circular top.  It had an orangey/red light in the middleand an outer see-through red/pink layer.
Six orange orbs floating in an arc in the sky. All following the sametrajectory and faded at similar points in the sky.
Saw an object which was round, yellowish colour.  Had a clear viewof the sighting for about two-three minutes.
Fifteen to twenty very bright orange lights travelling about a mileapart and in perfectly straight line.
Large orange light, stopped for several minutes and thendisappeared.
Pulsating/shimmering object flashing red, blue and green.
Eight orange lights over top of house.
Two orange balls of light. One ball of light was leading with the othertwo behind it.  No sound of any engines.
Three separate orange lights with no sound, hovered for approx 40minutes then blanked out of sight.
Three bright orange/red lights, followed by another three.
Loads of lights coming over the village, gaining height very quickly.
Seven lights.
Large luminous, pulsating object changed colour and shape.
Two bright orange objects. One from south at ferocious speed, thendead halt with others. Not man-made, no sound.
Five UFOs, two miles to the North East of Gatwick. They all shot upin the sky and disappeared one by one.
Orange object in sky getting higher and higher looked like a plasticbag with a flame in the middle. Round and glowing. Stopped in themiddle of the sky and disappeared.
Two orange/red dots in the sky. Seemed to be still but slowly movedadjacent to one another.  One then disappeared followed about aminute later by the other.
Saw three orange lights, then as they rounded a corner saw five information. No noise.
Silver object in sky over Deal.
Could not see a defined shape but no noise, no rear, port orstarboard lights. Two coned lights (yellow and white) flickeringrandomly. Finally disappeared into cloud.
Saw two UFOs. Looked like balls of fire.  As they approached RAFNortholt the fireball went out. However, the craft was still visible andwas in the shape of a jelly fish dome.
A perfect rectangle the length of car but 3 ft wide. Started swayingthen swooped like a bird. Witness followed it through the town.
Bright orange light, 1cm deep, joined by a second light, no sound.
Lights not sure what number.
Very sharp turn in jet stream, very sharp for an aircraft and very highup like a usual Airliner height.
Saw eight oranges lights on an oblong shaped object, no noise.
Eight lights at intervals, slowly flying.
Little moon thing.

Two bright objects. Disk shaped with red light that goes orange andthen back. On one of them the light went on and off and then theyboth went out. It looked like there was only one light on the ship.
Bright orange lights in the sky.
White and red lights moved around.
Ball of fire shot across the sky over her house.
Two orange glows, travelling quite fast, one in front of the other.Turned sharply and formed what appeared to be a triangular orarrow shape.
Fire in the sky, orange, moving slowly, hovered, the flames went outand it was 45 degrees from the ground.
Incredibly bright light in sky, at first light was white but changed tobright orange.  Appeared to be big and pulsating and followed him.Light shot across sky then disappeared.
Two objects seen in sky.
Two bright lights hovered, then turned north and headed inland.
Red and Green lights in sky with twinkles underneath, 3-4 minuteshovering, shot up and came back down, and hovered then shot off.Funny noises on mobile phone recorded.
Three red/orange lights in the shape of a triangle.  Moved silentlywith an exhaust type object coming from it.
No details given.
Fourteen objects one every minute, no sound.
Observed three objects in sky for about 10 minutes.  Appearedstationary and then disappeared behind clouds.  Changed shapefrom cigar to round.  Were red or white in colour.
Four lights moving around the sky, moving in a formation for overan hour.
Bright orange light travelling slowly.
Bright orange glow top of Rabbie Brae, hovered near VictoriaHospital and went up to the sky.
Two objects, no sound. One object three weeks ago.
Two triangular orange lights, about 10 seconds apart.
Nine red lights over the North Sea in a V formation - disappearedthen came back and was there for some time.
Triangle shape, with an orange ball in the middle, no noise.
14 balls of light, no formation, no noise.
White arrow shaped with green lights, moving slowly.
Objects seen to land in the reservoir.
Orange light, round shape, solid in the middle and straight.
Bright lights moving closer.
Orange lights front and back with white lights chasing sounded likefireworks but no flashes.
Strange cluster of objects at high altitude flying close togethertowards London.
Three red and orange lights, no noise.
Slow pulsing orange light, three lots of lights slow speed and silent.
Seven orange and red lights, not moving, no shape, disappearedone after another.
Light, size of a star erratic movements, looped then went out ofsight, reappeared and did futher loop.
Fourteen objects, yellowey orangey colour.  Then saw another 8-9.No sound.  Not on same flight trajectory.  States it could be chineselanterns.
Approx 24 objects.
Large orange burning object.
Twenty-five lights red and orange with vapour trail, disappearing intoblue green colours, spinning.
No details given.
Two orange glowing lights in sky high above Warburton Toll Bridge -strange shape like a no 7, fuzzy and close together.  No sound.
Three orange lights appeared then disappeared behind clouds.Further orange light and disappeared again.
Orange yellow bright light travelled fast across sky, followed byanother within 30 secs and repeated around ten times. Three balls oflight - one on top, two either side. No sound.
Orange object moving across the sky, flickering.
Two Orange lights, no noise, one disappeared, one static hoveredthen went away came back and went away again.
Object wasn’t flashing, moved across below cloud then droppeddown to the ground then disappeared.
Strange light activity, and lots of helicopters, unusual for the area.
Strange object in the sky over the sea, far away so difficult to define.
Two orange balls.  No sound. No strobe lights.
Glowing object like aircraft on fire from low down over the towncentre rising fast straight up in a straight line across town.
Two to four dancing lights with no density to them.
Metallic ball in the sky chased by fast jet then helicopter fromYeovilton.
Bright orangey red light lit from one end to the other, no noise,approx 40 - 50 feet long.
Like a flying bonfire, or similar to a plane on fire, too dark for aballoon.
Three bright orange objects, hovered for five minutes, beforeascending straight up into the sky. Strangely shaped. Another at17:52 & on 9 Oct at 20:00.
Red and orange lights high in the sky moving slowly, numeroussightings over several weeks.
Strange lights in the sky.
Two fiery red flame like objects hovered about then disappeared.
Bright orange spheres, got smaller the further away they went.
Lights in the sky, no object.  Orbs with trails following, moving in acircular direction.  Four orbs, two following the other two reaching apoint then repeating the sequence.
Two glowing crosses 50 metres apart silent, more 5 to 6 minuteslater, intelligent craft.
No description provided.
Airborne craft with non-conform lighting, steady strong orange.
10-12 orange lights in a row with no sound.
One orange light not flashing, three in a triangle formation.

Three to four silent aircraft three leading one trailing, bright redlights.

Really bright light jellyfish shaped object.

Circular with yellow and white lights.

Six objects, five large red balls, no lights moving steadily one behindthe other, for 10-15 minutes.  Sixth twice as big.
Five large round orange balls of lights in a formation: two front, onemiddle, two at the back, no sound.
Three UFOs sun bright orange looked like flames and had sort ofwings. First two were 2-3 miles apart, later one 10 miles to rear allgoing to the right no sound.

Yellow assorted lights much brighter than an average star.
Large orange object.
Six lights in S shape misty sky ground clear, gradually disappeared.

Orange circular lights very fast going West to Leeds centre.
Very bright light in the sky changing to green, no noise.

Clear and bright object long bluish white light with narrow tail, fast,gradual descent.

A single object full of lights approximately the same size as 10planes, the object made no noise.  Lights were seen to dim andchange colour with some turning off.  Object was described as astraight line of lights with a "U" shape attached underneath.
Like a balloon or lantern, hollow with bright orange light inside.

UFO appeared several times during the night.
Silent, off red, blood orange colour and entire sphere emitted light.No spotlights. Light remained constant and didn’t flicker. Saw forfour minutes.
21-22 high flying objects shining red at even intervals for around 15minutes.
Big orange ball moving slowly.
Amber glowing ball quarter of the size of the moons diameter,dimmed to nothing then vanished.
Four UFOs, three close together one behind, bright red glow arounda light with glow on the bottom no noise was close.
Large triangle structure with red light in each corner, red with fire inthe middle.
Orange lights in sky moving slowly then fading away.
Eight sightings not chinese lanterns saw one more a week later.
Formation of six bright orange lights in the sky, one minute behindwere two more, then one more the last was much bigger andbrighter.
Two bright orange lights.
Flat object in sky moving at rate of knots, looked strange.

Saw several very bright lights flying and drifting quickly and silentlyup in the sky.  They were bright, flickering, tiny white, green and lightred lights. I counted at least 10-15, some seemed to be drifting ingroups and others separately.
Two orange glowing orbs silent travelling in a straight line nottravelling fast and in tandem. Disappeared over Moseley area. Notfireworks.
Four slow moving round orange lights, completely silent, seemed toturn white and were pulsing.
Six orange lights not fireworks.
Reddish amber bright object flying across sky.
Saw UFO definitely not chinese lanterns.
Two red and bright lights but not glowing.
Orange sphere 30 degrees above eastern horizon speed substantial,no noise no normal navigation lights just eerie orange glow.

Orange light not a firework.

No description provided.
Two orange lights moving slowly south.  No sound, not jetafterburners, not helicopters as they did not flash.  Wrong colour fordistress rockets.

Three lights in sky 5 x 3 groups of disc shapes in a triangleformation.
Orange yellow UFO no contrails, no hazard lights flashing.
Orange ball shape going across the sky on a flight path.  Silent.  Soconcerned called 999.
Red and orange sphere half the size of the moon, no noise, but bitswere falling off it, tracked it for 20 seconds, saw a plane fourminutes later which might have seen it.
Seven orangish orbs floating over house in formation.
Four lights moving around in a circle over and over again for morethan an hour.
A kaleidoscope effect of lights above the building.
Very bright yellow in the centre surrounded by orange outer edge, afat boomerang on its side with a fire glow inside. Totally silent and30-40 ft across.

Two very bright, large lights, one higher than the other.  The lowerone then disappeared and reappeared above the higher one, theyswapped sides and then evened out to same level.  Theydisappeared when a planed came into view.
Large bright white light, no trailing light ray groundwards, so not apolice helicopter or aircraft heading for Mildenhall.  And no sound orvibration.
Bright light hovering in the sky, three parts, one was red appearedfor 45 minutes before it disappeared.
Seven to eight bright orange flame lights in the sky, not plane orhelicopter, no noise and moved fast, then disappeared.
Tiny speck of light over Southampton direction.  Seen twice bybinoculars.  N/NE explosion and bang, but not thunder lightening orfirework, lasted 30 seconds.
Two small red lights moving across the sky like fighter jets, but not afighter jet, reappeared again an hour later.
Four lights whirling about above the nature reserve.
Small ball of fire.
A mushroom shape light (like a balloon blowing in the wind) beingtracked by three brightly lit aircraft, saw approx 6-7 mushroomshapes and four aircraft.  Couldn't hear any engines.
Saw a bright red and orange object there was no noise or boom.Believe it was a probably a meteor.
Ten unidentified lights in the sky appeared for five minutes one afterthe other.
Saw a very large bright orange ball of fire travelling over woodland.There was no sound.  In size would have been 20 to 30 times biggerthan a jumbo jet.
Two orange large circular objects crossing the sky equal distanceapart, uniform speed, not shimmering, larger than a plane, half ametre in diameter.
Lights in the sky going up and down for the last half hour.
Very bright orange light in the sky always around 9pm, has appearedfour times recently, not a plane and no other explanation other thanUFO.
Two orange lights moving slowly over Wilmslow veered off in adifferent direction.  No noise and flashing flights not aircraft.
Strange orange light coming from the North, clear night, no port andstarboard indicators, translucent halo, lasted 1 min 20 secs, constantspeed, straight line.
